reviewText: All of BUENA VISTA's "Cartoon Capers" videotapes clock in at under a half hour, with only three animated shorts per edition. This final offering is three FLEISCHER Studio works. This sixth and final volume (subtitled "Musical Mischief") features: A CAR-TUNE PORTRAIT (1937) - Animator's hand draws an orchestra of animals who try to play the 2nd Hungarian Rhapsody in a dignified fashion. KING FOR A DAY (1940) - Gabby hand-delivers to the Little King what appears to be a death threat letter. LITTLE LAMBKIN (1940) - Precocious baby tricks family into returning to their country home (and his animal friends). RELATED ITEM: CARTOON CAPERS, VOL. 1 offers these FLEISCHER 'toons: "Play Safe," "Small Fry," and "Ants in the Plants."
